Summary Software developer/architect with advanced knowledge of Python, PHP, JavaScript, (X)HTML, and CSS, intermediate/advanced knowledge of ActionScript 2 and 3, and beginner knowledge of Ruby and Java. I've been a GNU/Linux user since 2006, so I feel pretty comfortable working on this kind of environment, both to develop on and to build systems to. 
 
What I like to do most is to program and design smart applications with well-organized object-oriented code, always building with Test Driven Development, using design patterns when it makes sense and refactoring all the time. By following the previous and other good practices, the software I build uses to have an excelent architecture. 
 
My favorite programming language is Python, and my favorite web framework is Django (or Tornado if I need event-driven I/O). 
 
I also have experience with libraries and frameworks like jQuery, Prototype/scrip.aculo.us, Symfony, Django and a bit of Ruby on Rails. Also a little knowledge of Erlang and PyQt, and, when I need to automate procedures I like to put my Bash and Make scripting knowledge to work. When it comes to versioning, what I like to use most is git, but I'm also comfortable with Bazaar and Mercurial, and, when it comes to put my personal stuff in production, I tend to use Provy for provisioning and Fabric for deploying. For Continuous Integration, I tend to use Jenkins more, but I've also had some experience with buildbot. When it comes to transactional and relational databases, I prefer using PostgreSQL for its robustness, stability and other qualities that I've found as making it usually better than other open-source players in the community. 
 
Specialties: Python, PHP, Django, Tornado, Symfony, jQuery, JavaScript, (X)HTML, CSS. Summary My main area of interest is Python ecosystem along with its various implementations like Jython and IronPython apart from canonical cPython. I've been using Python for 4 years now. Lately I've been looking a lot into PyPy and made it my host implementation for daily usage. I am closely tracing their progress in speed-ups, JIT, numpy and Python 3 implementation effort. 
 
I did several Python web projects. My favourite development stack in this area is based on Pyramid, Mako, beaker and sqlalchemy. I am using virtualenv and pip to manage my dependencies. Apart from sever-side work I am capable of slicing and doing all the front-end work. I am a HTML5 evangelist, proficent with CSS and accompanying browser rendering issues on different platforms. 
 
I have strong functional and OO background trying to accurately mix both styles according to problem that needs to be solved. I've been always following Zen of Python in this area preferring easy solutions to complex problems.
